item.title: District of Columbia House Voting Rights Act of 2007

latestAction.text: Committee on the Judiciary. Hearings held. Hearings printed: S.Hrg. 110-440.

item.title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to adjust the estimated tax payment safe harbor based on income for the preceding year in the case of individuals with adjusted gross income greater than $5 million.

latestAction.text: Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 317, H.R. 1906 is laid on the table. (consideration: CR H3600)

item.title: District of Columbia House Voting Rights Act of 2007

latestAction.text: Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 317, H.R. 1433 is laid on the table.

item.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 219 - 196 (Roll no. 229). (text: CR H3568)
Passed/agreed to in House: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 219 - 196 (Roll no. 229).(text: CR H3568)
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 219 - 196 (Roll no. 228). (consideration: CR H3575-3576)
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 317.
Considered as privileged matter. (consideration: CR H3568-3577)
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 39.

With respect to H.R. 1905, all points of order against the bill and against its consideration are waived except those arising under clause 9 or 10 of rule XXI. The bill shall be considered as read. The bill is closed to amendments and shall be considered in the House. With respect to H.R. 1906, all points of order against the bill and against its consideration are waived except those arising under clause 9 or 10 of rule XXI. The bill shall be considered as read. The bill is closed to amendments and shall be considered in the House. If either H.R. 1905 of H.R. 1906 fails of passage or fails to reach the question of passage by an order of recommittal, then both such bills, together with H.R. 1433, shall be laid on the table. In the engrossement of H.R. 1905, the Clerk shall append the text of H.R. 1906, as passed by the House, as new matter at the end of H.R. 1905. Upon that action, H.R. 1906 and H.R. 1433 shall be laid on the table.
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 110-98, by Mr. Arcuri.
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 110-98, by Mr. Arcuri.

summary.text: Sets forth the rule for consideration of the bill (H.R. 1905) to provide for the treatment of the District of Columbia as a Congressional district for purposes of representation in the House of Representatives, and for other purposes and providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 1906) to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to adjust the estimated tax payment safe harbor based on income for the preceeding year in the case of individuals with adjusted gross income greater that $5 million.

Sets forth the rule for consideration of: (1) H.R. 1905 (District of Columbia House Voting Rights Act of 2007); and (2) H.R. 1906 (amending the Internal Revenue Code to adjust the estimated tax payment safe harbor based on certain individual's income).

Sets forth the rule for consideration of: (1) H.R. 1905 (District of Columbia House Voting Rights Act of 2007); and (2) H.R. 1906 (amending the Internal Revenue Code to adjust the estimated tax payment safe harbor based on certain individual's income).

bill.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 1905) to provide for the treatment of the District of Columbia as a Congressional district for purposes of representation in the House of Representatives, and for other purposes and providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 1906) to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to adjust the estimated tax payment safe harbor based on income for the preceeding year in the case of individuals with adjusted gross income greater that $5 million.

Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 1905) to provide for the treatment of the District of Columbia as a Congressional district for purposes of representation in the House of Representatives, and for other purposes and providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 1906) to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to adjust the estimated tax payment safe harbor based on income for the preceeding year in the case of individuals with adjusted gross income greater that $5 million.

latestAction.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
